description.narrative: The Papua New Guinea (PNG) Food Futures Initiative supports a number of rural development activities in agriculture and food security. It includes a broad spectrum of activities aimed at connecting smallholder farmers to markets and creating more efficient agricultural value chains. Activities include support to women in agriculture, digital agriculture solutions, data collection and policy support and capacity building, agricultural education in schools, nutrition, and horticulture, poultry and aquaculture value chain development. The initiative partners with a range of Papua New Guinean, Australian and International organisations and personnel. Given the impact of Covid-19 in Papua New Guinea, activities under the initiative have been adapted to focus even more on food security and economic recovery. The total estimated value of this investment is $7.0 million to be expensed over 4 years, starting during the 2019-20 financial year.
